sn22.70:4.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha …
sn22.70:4.4: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dharma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and determined.”
sn22.70:4.6: “Mendicant, give up desire for anything that’s definitely arousing.”
sn22.70:5.1: “But how do you see the detailed meaning of my brief statement?”
sn22.70:5.3: I should give up desire for it.
sn22.70:5.8: I should give up desire for it.
sn22.70:5.9: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”
sn22.70:6.2: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.
sn22.70:6.4: you should give up desire for it.
sn22.70:6.9: you should give up desire for it.
sn22.70:6.10: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.” …
sn22.70:6.11: And that mendicant became one of the perfected.
